title: 113_hr4121
content:
The Small Business Development Centers Improvement Act of 2014, also known as the Small Business Act, authorizes entrepreneurial development programs. The Small Business Development Centers Improvement Act of 2014 authorizes programs for entrepreneurs, focusing on services like entrepreneurial education, business incubation, and growth acceleration. The Act specifies the use of certain programs to support small businesses, excluding those owned by Native Americans. The Administrator will provide an annual report to the Committees on Small Business regarding entrepreneurial development activities, including program descriptions and operating details. The Administrator will provide an annual report to the Committees on Small Business detailing procedures, grant award processes, awardees, funding amounts, and responsible individuals for each program and activity. SEC. 3. MARKETING OF SERVICES.

Section 21 of the Small Business Act is amended to allow grant recipients to market their services to individuals and small businesses.

SEC. 4. CONFIDENTIALITY REQUIREMENTS.

Section 21(a)(7)(A) of the Small Business Act is amended to include sharing information with State, local, or Federal agencies or third parties.

SEC. 5. DATA COLLECTION. Section 21(a)(3)(A) of the Small Business Act is amended to include governing data collection activities for grant applicants. Additionally, a new section (p) requires the Administrator to submit an annual report on data collection. The Administrator must annually report on data collection activities for the Small Business Development Center program to the House and Senate Small Business Committees. SEC. 6. Amends Small Business Act to allow Small Business Development Centers to collect fees from private partnerships. SEC. 7. Adjusts equity provisions for SBDCs. SEC. 8. Grants awarded to SBDCs. SEC. 8. Grants awarded to SBDCs are limited to entities that received grants before September 30, 2014, and seek to renew them. SEC. 9. Disaster reforms. Section 21(b)(3) of the Small Business Act is amended to provide assistance to out-of-state small businesses and authorize disaster recovery assistance through small business development centers. The Small Business Act is amended to provide disaster recovery assistance to small businesses outside the state during a declared disaster period. The Small Business Act is amended to ensure continuity of services and access to disaster recovery facilities for small business development centers during a declared disaster period. The Small Business Act is amended to allow small business development center personnel to use designated sites for disaster recovery assistance. SEC. 10. The Small Business Act is amended to include entrepreneurship training for unemployed individuals, focusing on educating them and assisting in starting new businesses.
